11.3 Indemnification.
11.3.1 Each Party agrees to indemnify, defend and hold harmless the Company and any other Party, its permitted
successors and assigns, from and against any and all losses, liabilities, claims, damages, costs and expenses including reasonable
legal fees and disbursements in connection therewith (collectively, “Claims”) asserted against or incurred by the Company or such
other Party which arise out of, result from, or may be payable by virtue of, any breach of any representation, warranty, covenant or
agreement made or obligation required to be performed by the indemnifying Party pursuant to this Agreement. Notwithstanding the
foregoing, claims related to the purchase of the Shares under the SPA shall be governed by the indemnification provisions set forth
in the SPA.
perturbation.changed_text:
11.3 Indemnification.
11.3.1 Each Party agrees to indemnify the Company from and against only direct and documented losses, liabilities, claims, damages, costs and expenses in connection therewith (collectively, “Claims”) arising directly from gross negligence or willful misconduct of the indemnifying Party. Claims related to the purchase of the Shares under the SPA shall be governed by the indemnification provisions set forth in the SPA.
perturbation.explanation: The original text provides a broad indemnification clause, holding each party responsible for losses, liabilities, claims, damages, costs, and expenses resulting from any breach of representation, warranty, covenant, or agreement. This is a standard level of protection.The modified text significantly narrows the scope of indemnification. By limiting indemnification to only 'direct and documented losses' and requiring 'gross negligence or willful misconduct,' it removes protection for the Company against ordinary breaches of contract, errors, or omissions that could still cause financial harm.This weakens the indemnification clause to such an extent that the indemnification protection is so thin and non-existent.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law and Corporate Law in Japan concerning standards of care and liability in commercial contracts.

perturbation.changed_text:
11.15.2 Any dispute, controversy or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, or the breach, termination or
invalidity hereof, may be resolved through negotiation between the parties. If negotiation fails, the parties may consider other methods of dispute resolution.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates binding arbitration through the Hong Kong International Arbitration Centre (HKIAC). This provides a structured and enforceable method for resolving disputes. The modified text removes the mandate for binding arbitration. By stating disputes 'may be resolved through negotiation,' it weakens the enforcement mechanism and creates uncertainty about the finality of dispute resolution. Parties are not obligated to pursue any formal resolution if negotiations fail, leaving potential conflicts unresolved and creating a legal contradiction with standard commercial dispute resolution practices.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Principles of Contract Law regarding enforceability of dispute resolution clauses, Arbitration Laws in Japan or potentially Hong Kong if the arbitration clause were to be invoked.

perturbation.original_text:
11.4 Confidentiality.
11.4.1 All information, whether written or oral, relating to the Company, the Parties or their Affiliates, or their
respective businesses or operations, which includes but is not limited to information obtained as a proprietary right (“Confidential
Information”), disclosed by any Party (the “Disclosing Party”) to any other Party (or its directors, officers, employees or
representatives) shall be kept strictly secret and confidential and shall not be disclosed to any Person except to the extent that any
such disclosure is necessary in connection with the performance of this Agreement, and except to the extent that (i) such
information is known to such other Parties when received or is or subsequently becomes lawfully obtained from other sources; (ii)
the duty as to confidentiality and non-use is waived in writing by the Disclosing Party; or (iii) disclosure of such information is
required by applicable Laws or is validly ordered by a Governmental Authority. The Parties further agree that they shall not use,
nor permit their respective Affiliates to use, any Confidential Information for any purpose whatsoever except in the manner
expressly provided or contemplated in this Agreement. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the treatment of any Confidential
Information disclosed pursuant to the Amended Process Development Agreement shall be governed solely by the Amended
Process Development Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
11.4 Confidentiality.
11.4.1 Information relating to the Company that is explicitly marked as 'Confidential' in writing at the time of disclosure shall be treated as confidential. This obligation does not apply to information that is publicly available or independently developed by a party.
perturbation.explanation: The original confidentiality clause provides broad protection for 'all information... relating to the Company,' whether written or oral, and includes a clear obligation to keep it 'strictly secret and confidential.' It includes specific exceptions. The modified clause drastically reduces the scope of confidentiality. It limits protection only to information 'explicitly marked as 'Confidential' in writing at the time of disclosure.' This creates a loophole where any unmarked information, even if sensitive, is not protected. The clause fails to provide any protection for oral confidential information.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Trade Secret Laws and general principles of Contract Law regarding confidentiality agreements in Japan.
